PAYLOAD.COURSE_NAME: Biology
PAYLOAD.WHO_THIS_COURSE_IS_FOR:
Course: Biology
        Provider: MEADOWHEAD SCHOOL ACADEMY TRUST
        Provider type: NCS
        Start Date: 1900-01-01T00:00:00Z
        Distance: 0.0
        Who is this course for? : Biological molecules, cells, how organisms exchange substances with their environment and genetic information, variation and relationships between organisms. _x000D_
Energy transfers in and between organisms, how organisms respond to changes in their internal and external environments, genetics, populations, evolution and ecosystems and the control of gene expression. 	
        Location: Sheffield
        Course type: nan
        Sector: nan
        Entry Requirements: GCSE 6-6 in Combined Sciences or  GCSE 6 in Biology plus one other science 6 grade; and a 5 in Maths
        Study Mode: Full Time
        LearnAimRefTitle: GCE A Level in Biology

PAYLOAD.COURSE_NAME: T Level Health and Science - Science
PAYLOAD.WHO_THIS_COURSE_IS_FOR:
Course: T Level Health and Science - Science
        Provider: UTC SHEFFIELD OLYMPIC LEGACY PARK
        Provider type: NCS
        Start Date: 2024-09-02T00:00:00Z
        Distance: 0.0
        Who is this course for? : You will develop a general understanding of health and science, including:_x000D_
_x000D_
Working within the health and science sector_x000D_
Health, safety and environmental regulations_x000D_
Managing information and data_x000D_
Principles of good scientific and clinical practice_x000D_
Core science concepts including the structure of cells, tissues and large molecules, genetics, microbiology and immunology_x000D_
_x000D_
You will also develop the knowledge and skills specific to science:_x000D_
_x000D_
Understanding the science sector_x000D_
Further science knowledge, including cell cycle and cellular respiration, enzyme and protein structure, pathogens, classification of biological materials, kinetic changes and relevant analytical techniques_x000D_
Scientific methodology_x000D_
Experimental equipment and techniques_x000D_
Ethics of science_x000D_
_x000D_
In addition to the core content, each student will also complete at least one module of occupation-specific content:_x000D_
_x000D_
Laboratory sciences_x000D_
Food sciences_x000D_
Metrology sciences
        Location: Sheffield
        Course type: T Levels
        Sector: nan
        Entry Requirements: There are no national entry requirements for starting a T Level. These are set by the individual college or school. Contact us to find out more.
        Study Mode: Full Time
        LearnAimRefTitle: nan

At least Grade 2 in GCSE Maths.

PAYLOAD.COURSE_NAME: GCE A Level in Biology A
PAYLOAD.WHO_THIS_COURSE_IS_FOR:
Course: GCE A Level in Biology A
        Provider: ECKINGTON SCHOOL
        Provider type: NCS
        Start Date: 2025-09-04T00:00:00Z
        Distance: 0.0
        Who is this course for? : This course is ideal for learners who have a strong interest in science of living things and their environments. Within the course students will learn about biological molecules, how organisms exchange materials with their environment and how they respond to changes in internal and external environments. Students will also explore genetics, populations, evolution and ecosystems, and the control of gene expression.
        Location: Sheffield
        Course type: nan
        Sector: nan
        Entry Requirements: Grade 6 GCSE Combined Science or Grade 6 GCSE Biology _x000D_
Grade 5 in GCSE English and Math
        Study Mode: Full Time
        LearnAimRefTitle: GCE A Level in Biology A

PAYLOAD.COURSE_NAME: Biology
PAYLOAD.WHO_THIS_COURSE_IS_FOR:
Course: Biology
        Provider: ALL SAINTS' CATHOLIC HIGH SCHOOL
        Provider type: NCS
        Start Date: 2024-09-03T00:00:00Z
        Distance: 0.0166
        Who is this course for? : The Biology A Level course builds upon the student's knowledge and understanding gained during GCSE Additional_x000D_
Science and Biology. Biology A Level will give students the skills they need to make connections and associations with_x000D_
all living things around them. Biology literally means the study of life and if that's not important, what is? Being such a_x000D_
broad topic, students are bound to find a specific area of interest._x000D_
_x000D_
A Level_x000D_
Biological molecules_x000D_
Cells_x000D_
Organisms exchange substances with their environment_x000D_
Genetic information, variation and relationships between organisms_x000D_
Energy transfers in and between organisms_x000D_
Organisms respond to changes in their internal and external environments_x000D_
Genetics, populations, evolution and ecosystems_x000D_
The control of gene and expression_x000D_
Assessment_x000D_
Biology, like all sciences, is a practical subject. Throughout the course you will carry out practical activities._x000D_
These practicals will give you the skills and confidence needed to investigate the way living things behave and work. It_x000D_
will also ensure that if you chose to study a Biology-based subject at university, you will have the practical skills needed_x000D_
to carry out successful experiments in your degree._x000D_
Skills developed and opportunities available_x000D_
Students develop skills in applying knowledge, analysing and interpreting data, presenting scientific arguments and_x000D_
ideas, carrying out investigative activities, including appropriate risk management in a range of contents._x000D_
The course lays the foundation for any further study of biology or related subjects in higher education. Possible careers_x000D_
include: Medicine, Biochemistry, Veterinary Sciences, Environmental Studies, Genetics, Ecology, Physiotherapy, Nursing,_x000D_
Sports Sciences.
        Location: Sheffield
        Course type: nan
        Sector: nan
        Entry Requirements: 5 GSCE Grade 4-9 including Mathematics and English Language and GCSE 6 in Biology / Science and GCSE grade 5 in Mathematics
        Study Mode: Full Time
        LearnAimRefTitle: GCE A Level in Biology

PAYLOAD.COURSE_NAME: GCSE Biology AQA
PAYLOAD.WHO_THIS_COURSE_IS_FOR:
Course: GCSE Biology AQA
        Provider: BARNSLEY COLLEGE
        Provider type: NCS
        Start Date: 2024-09-02T00:00:00Z
        Distance: 0.0
        Who is this course for? : GCSE Biology gives students the chance to gain a good understanding of Human Biology, Organisms, Evolution and the Environment. You will learn in the science laboratories with experienced and enthusiastic tutors. The specification integrates the principles of ‘Working Scientifically’ throughout the topics in required practical's. The course gives students the context of how science is applied in the outside world by real scientists. The course is aimed at any age group as education is ageless.
        Location: Barnsley
        Course type: nan
        Sector: nan
        Entry Requirements: You need to have English at grade D or above, maths at grade D_x000D_
Equivalent qualifications or experience accepted_x000D_
Functional Skills level 2 accepted_x000D_
Successfully complete an interview with Course tutor
        Study Mode: Part Time
        LearnAimRefTitle: GCSE (9-1) in Biology

PAYLOAD.COURSE_NAME: GCE A-Level in Biology
PAYLOAD.WHO_THIS_COURSE_IS_FOR:
Course: GCE A-Level in Biology
        Provider: CHAPELTOWN ACADEMY
        Provider type: NCS
        Start Date: 2024-09-01T00:00:00Z
        Distance: 0.0012
        Who is this course for? : A-level Biology is a challenging, rewarding course that will help you to develop skills and knowledge necessary for a successful career. _x000D_
_x000D_
Biology involves the study of a wide range of exciting topics ranging from molecular biology to the study of ecosystems and from microorganisms to fin whales. Biology is never far from the headlines either_x000D_
_x000D_
The human genome has been sequenced and we know the complete arrangement of the three thousand million bases that make up human DNA. In Kenya, roughly 4% of the population are living with AIDS and in South East Asia the skies are dark with smoke as the last Bornean rainforests are burned to grow oil palms._x000D_
_x000D_
Biologists are concerned with all these issues. They work in the fields of cell biology, medicine, food production and ecology._x000D_
_x000D_
The work they do is vital to us all.
        Location: Sheffield
        Course type: nan
        Sector: nan
        Entry Requirements: The Academy’s general entry criteria of a minimum of five 4s at GCSE applies, including English Language. A minimum of 5 in Biology GCSE (or two grade 5s if you have done double award science at GCSE) and a grade 5 in Maths, is needed to study Biology at A Level.
        Study Mode: Full Time
        LearnAimRefTitle: GCE A Level in Biology
